```{r}

plot_timeseries_onefactor <-  function(df, iv1,  mean, error, xlab, ylab, ggtitle, color) {

n_points <- 100  # Number of points for interpolation
    g <- ggplot(
      data = df,
      aes(
        x = .data[[iv1]],
        y = .data[[mean]],
        group = 1,
        color = color
      ),
      cex.lab = 1.5,
      cex.axis = 2,
      cex.main = 1.5,
      cex.sub = 1.5
    ) +

      geom_errorbar(aes(
        ymin = (.data[[mean]] - .data[[error]]),
        ymax = (.data[[mean]] + .data[[error]]),
        color = color
      ), width = .1, alpha=0.8) +

      geom_line() +
      geom_point(color=color) +
      ggtitle(ggtitle) +
      xlab(xlab) +
      ylab(ylab) +

      theme_classic() +

      theme(aspect.ratio = .6) +
      expand_limits(x = 3.25) +

      scale_color_manual("",
                         values =  color) +
            # scale_fill_manual("",
                         # values =  color) +
      theme(
        legend.position = c(.99, .99),
        legend.justification = c("right", "top"),
        legend.box.just = "right",
        legend.margin = margin(6, 6, 6, 6)
      ) +
      theme(legend.key = element_rect(fill = "white", colour = "white")) +
      theme_bw()

    return(g)
  }
```

## taskwise stim effect

```{r}
roi_list <- c('rINS', 'TPJ', 'dACC', 'PHG', 'V1', 'SM', 'MT', 'RSC', 'LOC', 'FFC', 'PIT', 'pSTS', 'AIP', 'premotor')
run_types <- c("pain", "vicarious", "cognitive")
  plot_list <- list()
  TR_length <- 42
for (ROI in roi_list) {

    datadir = file.path(main_dir, "analysis/fmri/spm/fir/ttl2par")
 taskname = 'pain'
exclude <- "sub-0001"
filename <- paste0("sub-*",  "*roi-", ROI, "_tr-42.csv")
  common_path <- Sys.glob(file.path(datadir, "sub-*",  filename
  ))
  filter_path <- common_path[!str_detect(common_path, pattern = exclude)]

df <- do.call("rbind.fill", lapply(filter_path, FUN = function(files) {
    read.table(files, header = TRUE, sep = ",")
    }))

for (run_type in run_types) {
  print(run_type)
  filtered_df <- df[!(df$condition == "rating" | df$condition == "cue" | df$runtype != run_type), ]

  parsed_df <- filtered_df %>%
    separate(condition, into = c("cue", "stim"), sep = "_", remove = FALSE)
  # --------------------- subset regions based on ROI ----------------------------
  df_long <- pivot_longer(parsed_df, cols = starts_with("tr"), names_to = "tr_num", values_to = "tr_value")

  # ----------------------------- clean factor -----------------------------------
  df_long$tr_ordered <- factor(
          df_long$tr_num,
          levels = c(paste0("tr", 1:TR_length))
      )
  df_long$stim_ordered <- factor(
          df_long$stim,
          levels = c("stimH", "stimM", "stimL")
      )

  # --------------------------- summary statistics -------------------------------
  subjectwise <- meanSummary(df_long,
                                        c("sub","tr_ordered", "stim_ordered"), "tr_value")
  groupwise <- summarySEwithin(
    data = subjectwise,
    measurevar = "mean_per_sub",
    withinvars = c( "stim_ordered", "tr_ordered"),
    idvar = "sub"
  )
  groupwise$task <- run_type
  # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29402528/append-data-frames-together-in-a-for-loop/29419402

  # ... Rest of your data processing code ...

  # subset <- groupwise[groupwise$runtype == run_type, ]
  LINEIV1 = "tr_ordered"
  LINEIV2 = "stim_ordered"
  MEAN = "mean_per_sub_norm_mean"
  ERROR = "se"
  dv_keyword = "actual"
  sorted_indices <- order(groupwise$tr_ordered)
  groupwise_sorted <- groupwise[sorted_indices, ]
  p1 <- plot_timeseries_bar(groupwise_sorted,
                            LINEIV1, LINEIV2, MEAN, ERROR,
                            xlab = "TRs",
                            ylab = paste0(ROI, " activation (A.U.)"),
                            ggtitle = paste0(ROI, ": ",run_type, " (N = ", length(unique(subjectwise$sub)),") time series, Epoch - stimulus"),
                            color = c("#5f0f40","#ae2012", "#fcbf49"))
  time_points <- seq(1, 0.46 * TR_length, 0.46)
  #p1 <- p1 + scale_x_discrete(labels = setNames(time_points, colnames(df_long)[7:(7 + TR_length)])) + theme_classic()

  plot_list[[run_type]] <- p1 + theme_classic()
}

  plot + theme(plot.margin = margin(5, 5, 5, 5))  # Adjust plot margins if needed
})

                  common.legend = TRUE,legend = "bottom", ncol = 3, nrow = 1,

}
```

```{r}
  filtered_df_cue <- df[df$condition == "cue" & df$runtype == run_type, ]

  # Let me show both approaches:
  
  # ============================================================================
  # APPROACH: Use stim epoch data but separate by TR timing
  # ============================================================================
  # Assuming TRs 1-4 are cue epoch, TRs 5-42 are stim epoch (adjust as needed)
  
  cue_TR_range <- 1:42  # Adjust based on your experimental design
  stim_TR_range <- 1:42  # Adjust based on your experimental design
  
  # Prepare stim data
  parsed_df_stim <- filtered_df_stim %>%
    separate(condition, into = c("cue", "stim"), sep = "_", remove = FALSE)
```

```{r}
df_long$tr_numeric <- as.numeric(gsub("tr", "", df_long$tr_num))

# Extract numeric run value

# For each subject and session, determine which run came first (1) vs second (2)
df_long <- df_long %>%
    group_by(sub, ses) %>%
    mutate(run_within_session = rank(run_numeric)) %>%  # 1 = first run, 2 = second run
    ungroup()

# Create global run order: session order (1,3,4) * 2 runs each = 6 runs total
df_long <- df_long %>%
    mutate(
        session_order = case_when(
            ses == "ses-01" ~ 1,
            ses == "ses-03" ~ 2,
            ses == "ses-04" ~ 3,
            TRUE ~ NA_real_
        ),
        run_order_global = as.integer((session_order - 1) * 2 + run_within_session)  # FORCE INTEGER
    )

# Filter for only high intensity stimuli (cueH_stimH and cueL_stimH)
df_high <- df_long %>%
    filter(sixcond %in% c("cueH_stimH", "cueL_stimH"))  # FIXED: was cueH_stimL

# --------------------------- summary statistics BY RUN ORDER -------------------
# Calculate subject-wise means for each GLOBAL RUN ORDER (not by session!)
subjectwise_run <- meanSummary(df_high,
                               c("sub", "run_order_global", "tr_ordered", "tr_numeric", "sixcond"), 
                               "tr_value")

# Calculate group-wise statistics - only group by run_order_global, NOT by session
groupwise_run <- summarySEwithin(
    data = subjectwise_run,
    measurevar = "mean_per_sub",
    withinvars = c("sixcond", "tr_ordered", "tr_numeric", "run_order_global"),
    idvar = "sub"
)

# Sort by run order and TR

    arrange(run_order_global, sixcond, tr_numeric)

# --------------------------------- plot each run ------------------------------
LINEIV1 = "tr_ordered"
LINEIV2 = "sixcond"
MEAN = "mean_per_sub_norm_mean"
ERROR = "se"

# Create a list to store plots - USE STANDARD LIST
plot_list <- list()

# Get unique runs in order
run_orders <- sort(unique(groupwise_run$run_order_global))

# Create labels for each run
run_labels <- c(
    "Run 1: Session 1, 1st run",
    "Run 2: Session 1, 2nd run",
    "Run 3: Session 3, 1st run",
    "Run 4: Session 3, 2nd run",
    "Run 5: Session 4, 1st run",
    "Run 6: Session 4, 2nd run"
)

for (i in run_orders) {
    # Subset data for this run
    run_data <- groupwise_run %>% 
        filter(run_order_global == i) %>%
        arrange(sixcond, tr_numeric)
    
    # Recreate tr_ordered with ONLY the levels present, in correct order
    unique_trs <- run_data %>%
        distinct(tr_ordered, tr_numeric) %>%
        arrange(tr_numeric) %>%
        pull(tr_ordered)
    
    run_data$tr_ordered <- factor(run_data$tr_ordered, levels = unique_trs)
    
    # Create plot
    p <- plot_timeseries_bar(
        run_data,
        LINEIV1, LINEIV2, MEAN, ERROR,
        xlab = "Time (seconds)",
        ylab = "Brain Activity (AU)",
        ggtitle = paste0(run_labels[i], " (N = ", unique(run_data$N), ")"),
        color = c("red", "#5f0f40")
    )
    
    # Create time labels
    n_trs <- length(unique_trs)
    time_points <- seq(0, (n_trs - 1) * 0.46, 0.46)
    time_labels <- round(time_points, 2)
    
    p <- p + 
        scale_x_discrete(labels = time_labels) +
        theme_classic() +
        theme(legend.position = "bottom")
    
    # Store with NUMERIC index, not the value of i
    plot_list[[length(plot_list) + 1]] <- p
    
    # Print the plot
    print(p)
}

# Create a combined figure with all 6 runs
library(gridExtra)
combined_plot <- grid.arrange(grobs = plot_list, ncol = 2, nrow = 3)

# To view the combined plot
print(combined_plot)
```

```{r}
                                       "tr_value")
        
        # Calculate group-wise statistics - only group by run_order_global, NOT by session
        groupwise_run <- summarySEwithin(
            data = subjectwise_run,
            measurevar = "mean_per_sub",
            withinvars = c("sixcond", "tr_ordered", "tr_numeric", "run_order_global"),
            idvar = "sub"
        )
        groupwise_run$task <- taskname
        
        # Sort by run order and TR
        groupwise_run <- groupwise_run %>%
            arrange(run_order_global, sixcond, tr_numeric)
        
        # --------------------------------- plot each run ------------------------------
        LINEIV1 = "tr_ordered"
        LINEIV2 = "sixcond"
        MEAN = "mean_per_sub_norm_mean"
        ERROR = "se"
        
        # Create a list to store plots
        plot_list <- list()
        
        # Get unique runs in order
        run_orders <- sort(unique(groupwise_run$run_order_global))
        
        # Create labels for each run
        run_labels <- c(
            "Run 1: Session 1, 1st run",
            "Run 2: Session 1, 2nd run",
            "Run 3: Session 3, 1st run",
            "Run 4: Session 3, 2nd run",
            "Run 5: Session 4, 1st run",
            "Run 6: Session 4, 2nd run"
        )
        
        for (i in run_orders) {
            # Subset data for this run
            run_data <- groupwise_run %>% 
                filter(run_order_global == i) %>%
                arrange(sixcond, tr_numeric)
            
            # Recreate tr_ordered with ONLY the levels present, in correct order
            unique_trs <- run_data %>%
                distinct(tr_ordered, tr_numeric) %>%
                arrange(tr_numeric) %>%
                pull(tr_ordered)
            
            run_data$tr_ordered <- factor(run_data$tr_ordered, levels = unique_trs)
            
            # Create plot
            p <- plot_timeseries_bar(
                run_data,
                LINEIV1, LINEIV2, MEAN, ERROR,
                xlab = "Time (seconds)",
                ylab = "Brain Activity (AU)",
                ggtitle = paste0(ROI, " - ", run_type, " - ", run_labels[i], " (N = ", unique(run_data$N), ")"),
                color = c("red", "#5f0f40")
            )
            
            # Create time labels
            n_trs <- length(unique_trs)
            time_points <- seq(0, (n_trs - 1) * 0.46, 0.46)
            time_labels <- round(time_points, 2)
            
            p <- p + 
                scale_x_discrete(labels = time_labels) +
                theme_classic() +
                theme(legend.position = "bottom")
            
            # Store plot
            plot_list[[length(plot_list) + 1]] <- p
            
            # Print the plot
            print(p)
        }
        
        # Create a combined figure with all 6 runs
        library(gridExtra)
        combined_plot <- grid.arrange(
            grobs = plot_list, 
            ncol = 2, 
            nrow = 3,
            top = textGrob(paste0("ROI: ", ROI, " - ", run_type, " - All Runs"), 
                           gp = gpar(fontsize = 16, fontface = "bold"))
        )
        
        # Print the combined plot
        print(combined_plot)
        
        # Optional: Save the combined plot
        ggsave(
            filename = paste0("roi_", ROI, "_", run_type, "_all_runs.png"),
            plot = combined_plot,
            width = 12,
            height = 14,
            dpi = 300
        )
        
        # ===============================================================================
        # END: RUN ORDER ANALYSIS
        # ===============================================================================
    }
}
```
